test-1.question: How do you control power in a jet engine?
options: A. By controlling the mixture ratio
B. By controlling the fuel flow 1
C. By controlling the airflow
D. By controlling the bleed valves

test-1.question:
If during pressurized flight the outflow valve closes
fully due to a fault in the pressure controller the:
options: A. skin will be overstressed and could rupture

B. safety valve opens when the differential pressure reaches
structural max diff 2

C. the inward relief valve will open to prevent excessive
negative differential
D. ECS packs are automatically closed down

test-3.question: An aircraft is allowed to descend below the MSA if:
options: A. the pilot follows the published approach procedures.
B. the aircraft receives radar vectors.

C. the pilot has visual contact with the runway and
surrounding terrain and is able to maintain visual contact.
D. all of the above.

test-3.question:
Lights on an airfield or in the vicinity can be
extinguished if they can be re-lit:
options: A. at least 5 minutes before the ETA of the aircraft.
B. at least 15 minutes before the ETA of the aircraft.
C. at least 30 minutes before the ETA of the aircraft.
D. at least 60 minutes before the ETA of the aircraft. 2

test-3.question: Air Traffic Service unit consists of:
options: A. Air Traffic Control Units and Flight Information Centres.

B. Flight Information Centres and Air Services Reporting
offices.

C. Air Traffic Control Units, Flight Information Centres and
Air Traffic Services Reporting offices. 3

D. Air Services Reporting offices and Air Traffic Control
Units.

test-3.question:
A marshaller crosses his/her hands in front of the face,
palms outwards and then moves the arms outwards. What does this signal
indicate?
options: A. Clear to move forward.
B. Brakes off.
C. Remove chocks. 4
D. Clear to close all engines.

test-3.question:
A fixed obstacle that extends above a take-off climb
surface within ___ shall be marked and, if the runway is to be used at night,
must be lit.
options: D. 2 NM

test-3.question:
Repetitive flight plans (RPLs) cannot be used for flights
other than those executed frequently on the same days of following weeks and:
options:
A. for at least 20 occasions or every day over a period of
at least 20 consecutive days. 6
B. for at least 20 consecutive days.

C. for at least 10 occasions or every day over a period of
at least 10 consecutive days. 7
D. for at least 20 occasions.
test-3.answer:
C (Note: The document has checkmarks next to
both A and C, indicating a potential error in the source material. C is
generally considered the correct ICAO standard).

test-3.question: A PAPI must consist of:
options:
A. a row of 4 multiple lights or paired units without
transition zone, at equal distance from each other. 8

B. two rows of 4 multiple lights or paired units without
transition zone, at equal distance from each other.

C. a row of 2 multiple lights or paired units without
transition zone, at equal distance from each other.

D. two rows of 6 multiple lights or paired units without
transition zone, at equal distance from each other.

test-3.question:
What is the length of the approach lighting system of a
Cat II precision landing runway?

An aircraft is maintaining FL150 in Class C Airspace.
Another aircraft below at FL140 receives a clearance to descend to FL70. There
is severe turbulence in the area. When at earliest can a clearance be expected
to descend to FL140 or lower?
options:
A. When the other aircraft has reported to be descending
through FL130. 13
B. When the other aircraft has reported to have left FL120.
C. When the other aircraft has reported to have left FL140.
D. When the other aircraft has reached FL70.

test-3.question:
The VMC minima for a VFR flight within ATS airspace
class B are:
options:
A. 8 km visibility at or above 3050 m AMSL and clear of
cloud.

B. 5 NM visibility at or above 3050 m AMSL, 1500 m
horizontal and 300 m vertical clear of cloud.

C. 8 km visibility at or above 3050 m AMSL, 1500 m
horizontal and 300 m vertical clear of cloud. 14

D. 5 NM visibility at or above 3050 m AMSL and clear of
cloud.

test-3.question:
When independent parallel approaches are used on
parallel runways and headings (vectors) are given to intercept the ILS, the
given heading must be such that the aeroplane can establish on the localizer
course or the MLS final approach track in level flight over at least:
options:
A. 2.5 NM before the ILS glide slope or the specified MLS
elevation angle is intercepted. 15

B. 1.5 NM before the ILS glide slope or the specified MLS
elevation angle is intercepted.

C. 3.0 NM before the ILS glide slope or the specified MLS
elevation angle is intercepted.

D. 2.0 NM before the ILS glide slope or the specified MLS
elevation angle is intercepted. 16

test-3.question: When the captain cannot comply with an ATC clearance:
options:
A. the Captain must accept the ATC clearance, because it is
based on a filed flight plan.

B. he/she may request an amended clearance and, if
executable, he/she will accept that clearance. 17

C. he/she may ask for a new clearance and the appropriate
ATC must grant him/ her that clearance.
D. he/she may suggest a new clearance to ATC.

test-3.question:
The minimum number of rescue and fire fighting vehicles
required for a Cat 8 Aerodrome is:
options: D. None of the above is correct.

test-3.question: Lights at the end of the runway shall be:
options:
A. steady unidirectional lights radiating white light in the
direction of the runway.
B. steady white lights with controllable intensity.

C. steady omni-directional red lights with controllable
intensity.

D. steady unidirectional lights radiating red light in the
direction of the runway. 19

test-3.question: What is required for an IFR flight in advisory airspace?
options: A. No flight plan required.

B. Flight plan required and PIC must notify of any changes
regardless if wanting advisory service or not. 20

C. Flight plan required but PIC need not notify of any
changes.

D. A flight plan is only required if advisory service is
required.

test-3.question: The transition from IFR to VFR is done:
options: A. on the Captain's initiative. 21
B. whenever an aircraft in VMC leaves controlled airspace.
C. if told by ATC.

D. at the clearance limit, disregarding the weather
situation.

test-3.question:
The longitudinal separation minimum based on time
between aircraft at the same FL, where there is enough coverage for navigation
aids and the preceding aircraft has a higher true airspeed of 20 kt minimum is:
options: A. 3 minutes. 22
B. 15 minutes.
C. 5 minutes. 23
D. 10 minutes.

test-3.question:
What is the separation that must be maintained before
intercepting the ILS on an independent parallel approach?

test-4.question: A Type Rating is applicable to:
options: A. an aircraft requiring a Certificate of Airworthiness1.

B. an aircraft with a Certificate of Airworthiness issued by
the State2.
C. an aircraft that requires multi-pilot operation3.
D. an aircraft that requires additional skills training4.

test-4.question: Fixed distance markers, when provided, shall commence:
options: A. 150 metres from the threshold5.
B. 300 metres from the far end threshold6.
C. 300 metres from the threshold7.
D. 150 metres from the far end threshold8.

test-4.question: What is the minimum width of a code 4 runway?

options: A. the take-off run available excluding the clearway13.

B. the take-off run available including the
clearway14141414.
C. the take-off run available excluding the stopway15.
D. the take-off run available only16.

test-4.question:
Temporary changes of long duration (3 months or more) and
information of short duration which contains extensive graphics and/or text are
published as AIP Supplements. Check lists of these Supplements which are in
force are sent to recipients at intervals of not more than:
options: A. one year17171717.
B. one month18.
C. one week19.
D. 2 weeks20.

test-4.question:

options:
A. from the moment they have been cleared through customs of

B. from the moment they step from the aircraft onto the

C. from the moment they have been admitted into the

D. from the moment they step from the aircraft onto the

options: B. NNNN30.
D. A/D XXX32.

test-4.question:
What is the width of a code letter D taxiway used by
aircraft with an outer gear wheel span of more than 9 m ?
test-4.answer:
C (Assuming position implies correctness -
no checkmark in source)

test-4.question: Which International Agreement relates to Penal Law?
options: B. Montreal38.
C. Hague39.
D. Rome40.

test-4.question:

test-4.question:
An RNP1 route designated as A342Y, indicates that the
route is at or above FL200 and all turns shall be made within the allowable RNP
tolerance of a tangential arc between the straight leg segments with a radius
of:
options: A. 10 NM for turns between $30^{\circ}$ and $90^{\circ}$45.
B. 15 NM for turns between $30^{\circ}$ and $90^{\circ}$46.

C. 22.5 NM for turns between $30^{\circ}$ and
$90^{\circ}$47.
D. 30 NM for turns between $30^{\circ}$ and $90^{\circ}$48.
test-4.answer:
C (Assuming position implies correctness -
no checkmark in source)

test-4.question:
ATIS will only broadcast cloud base information when the
cloud base is:
options: C. when Cb are present51.
D. when the cloud base is below MSA52.

test-4.question: What are the objectives of ATC Services?

B. To prevent collisions between controlled aircraft and to
expedite and maintain an orderly flow of air traffic66.

C. To provide separation of aircraft and to expedite and
maintain an orderly flow of air traffic67.

D. To provide separation of controlled aircraft and to
expedite and maintain an orderly flow of air traffic68.

test-4.question:

route is at or below FL190 and all turns shall be made within the allowable RNP

options: A. 10 NM for turns between $30^{\circ}$ and $90^{\circ}$69.

C. 22.5 NM for turns between $30^{\circ}$ and

test-4.question:
A heavy aircraft makes a missed approach on a parallel
runway in the opposite direction. A light aircraft has a wake turbulence

options: A. more than 760 m apart81.
B. more than 915 m apart82.
C. less than 915 m apart83.
D. less than 760 m apart84.

test-5.question:
Which of the following statements regarding an electric
circuit is correct?
options:
A. an electric current is only able to flow in an open
circuit

B. the magnitude of the current is proportional to the
resistance
C. lower diameter wires are able to carry a higher current
D. too high a current may lead to the circuit overheating 1

test-5.question: The purpose of an ignition switch is to:
options: A. connect the battery to the magneto
B. control the primary circuit of the magneto 2

C. connect the contact breaker and condenser in series with
the primary coil
D. connect the secondary coil to the distributor

test-5.question: Which of the following are all aerodynamic balances?
options: A. Inset hinge, mass balance and spring tab.
B. Horn balance, balance tab and internal balance. 3
C. Horn balance, inset hinge and mass balance.
D. Internal balance, anti-balance tab and servo tab.

test-5.question: Propeller blade angle is:
options: A. the angle between the relative airflow and the chord line
B. dependent upon RPM and TAS

C. the angle between the blade chord and the plane of
rotation 4

D. the difference between effective pitch and geometric
pitch

test-5.question: The skin of a modern pressurised aircraft:
options:
A. is made up of light alloy steel sheets built on the
monocoque principle
B. houses the crew and the payload

C. is a primary load bearing structure carrying much of the
loads 5

D. provides aerodynamic lift and prevents corrosion by
keeping out adverse weather

test-5.question:
What does TEM stand for in the context of Human
Performance?
options: A. Threat and Error Management 6
B. Trusted Equipment Mechanic
C. Time Limited Evacuation Medical
D. Tango, Echo, Mike

test-5.question:
What is the shortest distance between two points on the
Earth's globe called:
options: A. Lambodrome
B. Great circle 7
C. Airway
D. Rhumb Line

test-5.question: Leaving ground effect at a given angle of attack the:
options: A. Induced drag decreases.
B. effective angle of attack decreases. 8
C. lift will remain constant
D. nose tends to pitch down.
test-5.answer:
B (Note: The document has checkmarks next to
B and C. B describes the aerodynamic effect, while C is incorrect.)

test-5.question: A turbo-supercharger impeller is driven by:
options: A. excess torque from the reduction gearbox

B. diversion of exhaust gases by the waste gate using energy
that would otherwise be wasted 9
C. a ram air turbine

D. a connection through a gearbox connected to the
crankshaft

test-5.question:
The weight of an aeroplane, which is in level non
accelerated flight, is said to act:
options: A. vertically through the datum point
B. vertically through the centre of pressure
C. vertically through the centre of gravity 10
D. always along the vertical axis of the aeroplane

test-5.question:
When an aircraft fitted with a classic air-driven
artificial horizon decelerates after landing, a wrong indication will be
displayed showing a:
options: A. climbing turn to left
B. descending turn to left
C. descending turn to right,
D. climbing turn to right.
test-5.answer:
D (Assuming position implies correctness -
no checkmark in source)

test-5.question:

causes the ASI to:
options: A. over-indicate then under-indicate
B. over-indicate
C. under-indicate 11
D. be unaffected

test-5.question: Flutter may be caused by a:
options: A. low airspeed aerodynamic stall,

B. distortion by bending and torsion of the structure
causing increasing vibration in the resonance frequency. 12
C. high airspeed aerodynamic wing stall.
D. roll control reversal.

test-5.question: With regards to the Maximum Zero Fuel Weight (MZFW):
options:
A. It is lower than the Maximum Take-Off Weight by the
weight of a payload.

B. It is the maximum weight that an aircraft can be loaded
to without useable fuel. 13

C. It is important as exceeding the MZFW may mean that there
is insufficient lift to get the aircraft airborne.
D. Is more relevant to aircraft with fuselage fuel tanks.

test-5.question:
What is the effect on Mach No and TAS when climbing at a
constant CAS?
options: A. Mach No increases, TAS is constant
B. Both increase 14
C. Mach No is constant, TAS increases
D. Both decrease

test-5.question: What is the purpose of trim tabs?
options: A. to reduce control effectiveness
B. to reduce stick forces during manoeuvres
C. to increase control effectiveness
D. to reduce stick forces to zero 15

options: A. 25kHZ
B. 25MHZ
C. 8.33MHZ

options: A. It increases from south to north

C. It remains constant throughout the year
D. It remains constant from north to south

test-5.question:
What is the correct phrase for a pilot to use to advise
ATC of being ready to take-off?
options: A. Request takeoff.
B. Request departure.
C. Ready for departure. 19
D. Ready for take-off.

test-2.question: The result of Empty Field Myopia is:
options: A. astigmatism
B. a build-up of pressure within the eye
C. focusing is limited to between 1 and 2 meters 20
D. a tendency to suffer from cataracts in the long term

options: A. At a speed faster than 1,32 VMD 23

D. At a speed slower than 1,32 VMD

test-2.question:

the governing factor is:
options: A. the energy of the circuit
B. the power requirement of the circuit 24
C. the resistance of the circuit
D. the voltage of the circuit

test-2.question:
A logarithmic scale is fitted to the vertical speed
indicator in order to:
options: A. make the instrument more sensitive.
B. make lower values of vertical speed easier to read 25
C. Reduce pressure error.
D. Reduce manoeuvre error.

test-2.question: In relation to persons with Reduced Mobility (PRM's):
options: A. The commander may be notified when PRM's are carried
B. The commander must be notified when PRM's are carried 26

C. There is no requirement to notify the commander when
PRM's are carried
D. PRM's must be seated adjacent to emergency exits

test-2.question: Which of the following statements is true?
options:
A. Super-alloys are used because of their excellent
corrosion resistance

B. Titanium alloy is used in aircraft construction because
of its good wear and high temperature tolerance 27

C. Steel is used in aircraft because it is strong and heavy
but has poor corrosion resistance

D. Aluminium alloys are used in aircraft construction
because they are light, easily machined and have good wear resistance
test-2.answer:
B (Note: D is also largely true, but
Titanium's high-temp tolerance is a key reason for its use)

test-2.question:
A pilot, trying to pick up a fallen object from the
cockpit floor during a right turn, experiences:
options: A. Coriolis illusion/effect 28
B. Pressure vertigo
C. Autokinetic illusion
D. Barotrauma

test-2.question: Which of the following statements is true?
options:
A. By increasing the flap setting in severe turbulence at
constant speed the stall speed will be reduced and the risk for exceeding the
structural limits will be decreased.

B. Flap extension in severe turbulence at constant airspeed
moves the centre of pressure aft, which increases the structural limitation
margins.

C. Flight in severe turbulence may lead to a stall and/or
structural limitations being exceeded. 29

D. Flap extension in severe turbulence at constant speed
increases both the stall speed and the structural limitation margins.

test-2.question: The oil in an oleo-pneumatic strut:
options: A. Support the weight of the aircraft

B. Limits the speed of extension and compression of the
strut 31
C. Limits the speed of compression of the strut
D. Lubricates the piston within the cylinder

test-2.question:
The inbound track to the navigation aid serving a hold
is $250^{\circ},$ your aircraft heading is $002^{\circ}$ What is the correct
sector to join the hold?
options: A. Sector 2 (offset)
B. Sector 1 (parallel) or sector 3 (direct)
C. Sector 2 (offset) or sector 3 (direct)
D. Sector 1 (parallel) 32
test-2.answer:
D (Heading 002 is within 70 degrees of the
reciprocal 070, indicating Sector 1 Parallel entry)

test-2.question: Which of the following statements is correct?
options:
A. modern batteries are more stable and have virtually
eliminated the risk of a thermal runaway occurring

B. batteries are not sensitive to damage because of their
solid construction and sealed casing

C. the risk of a battery fire is reduced during charging as
the charging current will be cut off if a fire is detected

D. batteries are considered dangerous goods if transported
due to the risk of thermal runaway and the substances inside 33

options: A. The distance from the CG to the CP
B. The distance from the datum to the CG 34
C. The distance from the CG to the static margin
D. The distance from the datum to the CP

D. is connected to the battery in an emergency

test-3.question:
You are flying IFR in VMC and experience a complete radio
failure. What action should you take?
options:
A. Continue VMC and land at the nearest aerodrome squawking
7600. Report arrival to ATC after landing 20

B. Continue as per last ATC clearance for 20 minutes after
which revert to your filed flight plan. Squawk 7500 and land as close as
possible to your EAT/ΕΤΑ. Report arrival to ATC after landing 21

C. Continue as per last ATC clearance for 30 minutes after
which revert to your filed flight plan. Squawk 7600 and land as close as
possible to your EAT/ETA. Report arrival to ATC after landing 22

which revert to your filed flight plan. Squawk 0000 and land as close as
possible to your EAT/ETA. Report arrival to ATC after landing 23

D. VOR callsign once every 30 secs and higher in pitch than

test-4.question: If the TAS at 40000 ft is 450 kt the Mach No. is:
test-4.answer:
B (LSS at 40000 ft ≈ 573.6 kt. Mach No
= TAS / LSS = 450 / 573.6 ≈ 0.784)
